artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsujiokaya Kamekichi; Carver: Watanabe Yatarō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 479.5; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 185, p. 290.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two sheets; scene inside building in mountains, with snowy landscape visible outside open door at left; older kneeling man at right with long white hair and white beard, wearing brown kimono with white circles, holding a small piece of wood defensively in his PR hand; younger man at left with two short swords, wearing short black jacket and green pants with white patterning
dimension: 14 1/2 × 9 7/8 in. (36.83 × 25.08 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban diptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年 {Yoshitoshi} | Carver’s seal: ホリヤタ {hori Yata}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Newly Selected Eastern Brocade Prints (Shinsen Azuma nishiki-e 新撰東錦絵)
title: Picture of the Duel between Musashi and Tsukahara
